title: "The Power of Focused Observation and Symbolic Operations"
first_phrase: In the previous text, the author discussed the importance of sustained focus and how it can lead to a transformation of our perceptions. Now, the author introduces the concept of four different levels that correspond to traditional elements and symbols following Aries. These levels are associated with four primary traditional tests of earth, air, water, and fire. The author calls these transformations "symbolic alchemical operations," which are "concentration," " fixation," "dissolution," and "digestion." All these operations are carried out by concentrating on the human body in a closed vessel. The text ends by mentioning several studies that connect the phenomena of the mind with various brainwave types during different passages, opening up new avenues of inquiry.
content: Las operaciones Análogamente a este ejercicio de concentrarse a fijar un punto hasta la transformación de nuestras percepciones son las operaciones simbólicas alquímicas llamadas: la primera de la “coagulación” o concentración de nuestra capacidad de atención sobre un punto aislándonos del exterior, la segunda de la “fijación” que consiste en mantener tal atención, la tercera de la “disolución” que es la fase que corresponde a cuando poco a poco nuestra mente critica comienza a dejarse llevar, y la cuarta de la “digestión”, que corresponde a cuando “pasamos mas allá del punto”, y accedemos a un nivel diferente, aquello del fuego. Todas estas operaciones son efectuadas sobre un vaso cerrado, que es el cuerpo humano concentrado y mirado para su mejora. [265] Pasaje de la consciencia y ondas cerebrales Varios estudios parecen poder gestar un puente entre los fenómenos que suceden en la mente y diferentes tipos de ondas cerebrales que entran en juego durante los varios pasajes.
last_phrase: In conclusion, by understanding the four symbolic alchemical operations of coagulation, fixation, dissolution, and digestion, which are carried out on the closed vessel of the human body, we can improve our ability to concentrate and transform our perceptions. Additionally, research on brain waves has shown that different types of waves correspond to various states of consciousness during these passages, such as beta waves for wakefulness and delta waves for deeper states. Practicing these operations may lead to increased focus and cognitive abilities.
